private_information: I am allowed to move disks A B C D E F G H
I can only perform moves that relocate one of these disks at a time
I must obey the Tower of Hanoi rule that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves that, together with agent_2, achieve the global Tower of Hanoi goal configuration

private_information: I am allowed to move disks I J K L M N O
I can only perform moves that relocate one of these disks at a time
I must obey the Tower of Hanoi rule that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves that, together with agent_1, achieve the global Tower of Hanoi goal configuration

private_information: I coordinate agent_1 and agent_2 and integrate their contributions
I produce the final ordered list of primitive moves and a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent contributions to produce the final move sequence and the PDDL domain and problem that solve the Tower of Hanoi instance

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi instance with three pegs named left middle right
There are 15 disks labeled A through O where A is the smallest and O is the largest
Initial configuration on the left peg from top to bottom is A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O
Goal configuration is left peg top to bottom F G H I J K L M N O, middle peg top to bottom C D, right peg top to bottom A B E
Only one disk may be moved at a time
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Agent movement restrictions: agent_1 may move disks A B C D E F G H and agent_2 may move disks I J K L M N O

contribution.system_prompt: You are agent_1. Your role is to analyze the environment and propose an ordered sequence of primitive moves that you are allowed to perform. You must respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk permissions. Provide the moves as plain strings in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not produce PDDL. Focus only on moves that involve disks A B C D E F G H.
contribution.prompt: You are agent_1. Use the public information about the environment and your private information to produce an ordered list of primitive moves you can perform. The public information is available as {environment->public_information}. Your private_information is {agents->agent_1->private_information}. The global goal is {agents->agent_1->goal}. Output only the move list in the specified format.

contribution.system_prompt: You are agent_2. Your role is to analyze the environment and propose an ordered sequence of primitive moves that you are allowed to perform. You must respect the Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk permissions. Provide the moves as plain strings in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'. Do not produce PDDL. Focus only on moves that involve disks I J K L M N O.
contribution.prompt: You are agent_2. Use the public information about the environment and your private information to produce an ordered list of primitive moves you can perform. The public information is available as {environment->public_information}. Your private_information is {agents->agent_2->private_information}. The global goal is {agents->agent_2->goal}. Output only the move list in the specified format.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. You must integrate the move contributions from agent_1 and agent_2 and produce two outputs. First, a final ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' that respects disk permissions and Tower of Hanoi rules. Second, a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that encode this Tower of Hanoi instance targeting the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct in the PDDL by prefixing action names with the agent name where relevant. The PDDL must be solvable by FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the move contributions named {agent_1_moves} and {agent_2_moves}. Integrate them to produce a single consistent ordered move list that achieves the global goal {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Then produce a PDDL domain and problem that model the instance and the integrated plan suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Also output the final ordered move list as plain strings in the format specified.
